meanings.def: a narrow line of light, heat or other energy
examples: The last of the sun's rays shone on the grass.
Ultraviolet rays damage the skin.
The windows were shining in the reflected rays of the setting sun.
Raise your hand if you know the answer.
You work so hard, you deserve a raise!
Rays of sunlight streamed through the window.
They wanted to raze the old town centre to make room for new architecture.
A ray of sunlight fell on the table.
Her brooch caught the rays of the setting sun.
The moon cast pale rays of light on the ground.
They basked in sun's warm golden rays.
When the sun's rays hit the earth, a lot of heat is reflected back into space.
a blinding ray of light
a stream sparkling in the rays of the June sun
creams which filter out the sun's harmful ultraviolet rays
the dying rays of a winter sun
the moon's rays filtering through the trees

meanings.def: a small amount of something good or of something that you are hoping for
examples: There was just one small ray of hope.
The one ray of light in this whole affair is that justice has been done.

meanings.def: a sea fish with a large broad flat body and a long tail, that is used for food
the second note of a major scale
to sit or lie in the sun, especially in order to get a suntan
a person or thing that makes life brighter or more cheerful
examples: My nephew is a little ray of sunshine.

meanings.def: a first name for boys, short for Raymond

(1902-84) the American who developed McDonald's into the biggest fast food restaurant company in the world. In 1955 he bought the company and its name from two brothers, Richard and Maurice McDonald, who had one restaurant in San Bernardino, California. Kroc created the gold arches which are the McDonald's symbol, and established a Hamburger University to train the company's employees.
